dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 4255 IH: To amend the Act commonly known as the Indian Long-Term Leasing Act to expand certain exceptions for long-term lease limits for the Pueblo of Santa Clara.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ben Ray Luján of New Mexico introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Act commonly known as the Indian Long-Term Leasing Act to expand certain exceptions for long-term lease limits for the Pueblo of Santa Clara.

section.text: The Act of August 9, 1955 (commonly known as the Indian Long-Term Leasing Act; 25 U.S.C. 415(a)), is amended in subsection (a) of the first section—

paragraph.text: by striking the Puyallup Tribe of Indians,, and inserting the Puyallup Tribe of Indians, the Pueblo of Santa Clara,;
by striking leases of the the lands comprising the Moses Allotment Numbered 8 and inserting leases of the lands comprising the Moses Allotment Numbered 8; and
by striking lands held in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara,.
